Key Match Events: Ibáñez hit a tiebreaking three-run double in the eighth inning, giving Detroit a 5-2 lead.
Carpenter's one-out single and a wild pitch by Pressly advanced Carpenter to third, setting up the rally.
Ibáñez lined a 1-2 sinker into the corner in left field, scoring Vierling, Keith, and Torkelson for a 5-2 lead.
Meadows homered in the sixth inning, providing an early boost for Detroit.
Pre-Game Insights: Parker Meadows homered as Detroit ended Houston’s run of seven consecutive appearances in the AL Championship Series.
It was a sweet moment for Tigers manager A.J. Hinch, who led Houston to a championship in 2017 and was fired in the aftermath of the Astros’ sign-stealing scandal.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers used seven different pitchers in the game, showcasing depth and versatility.
The win marked the Tigers' first playoff series win since the 2013 ALDS.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston's ALCS streak included four World Series appearances and two titles, but they lost their seventh straight postseason game at home.
Hunter Brown struck out nine in 5 1/3 innings in his eighth postseason game and first start.
